author: Smarti

comment: BEFORE she met Mr. Depp, in 2009, in the Seattle/Tacoma International Airport, Amber Heard was arrested for the domestic assault of her partner Tasya van Ree. Ms. van Ree did not protest the arrest. She did not bail her out, Ms. Heard had to spend the night in jail. She did not appear at Ms. Heard's arraignment the next day. The Judge chastised Ms. Heard, which she did not protest, and the court left the case open in the event that Ms. Heard re-offended. When Ms. Heard met Mr. Depp she attempted to have her record expunged. Unfortunately for her, airports must keep a record of arrests on site. When it became public, Ms. Heard had Ms. van Ree (the assault victim) make a statement that the arresting officer was homophobic and had exaggerated the event. The arresting officer , Beverly Leonard, came forward as an openly gay woman and activist,  having volunteered at domestic violence shelters, had not mistaken "grabbing an arm" with the domestic assault that she had witnessed. This information is in the public domain, and TMZ has links to the legal documents. This assault alone would have caused any man to lose an acting role (can you imagine if a man went to a woman he assaulted to get a statement to clear his name?) Replace Amber Heard. It is only going to get worse when Mr. Depp presents the evidence that clears his name.
